com:
>What is it?
https://www.pokeclicker.com/
Pokéclicker is an open-source game built around the story and content of the Pokémon games. This is an idle & clicker type game that is currently in beta release phase. New content and patches are released frequently.

>Crobat?
https://crobat4.github.io/pokeclicker/
A modified version of Pokeclicker that features QoL changes from the original, including a Dock shortcut, type-based pokeball selection, Gen 3+ berries being available in dungeons, un-nerfed experience gains, and some egg-exclusive pokemon being available through other means.

>Wiki
https://pokeclicker.miraheze.org/wiki/Home_Page

>CODES
Start Menu > Save > Enter Code
>OOOSHINY
Free shiny
>FARMINGBOOST
10,000 Farm Points and 100 Cheri Berries
>CROBATISBASED (Crobat fork only)
Awards a Rotom (Crobat)

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>52595436
Arven being so abrasive at the beginning is absolutely integral to his character.
We obviously don't know what's going with him, we just think he's an asshole for no reason. However, the game does add some mystery to him right at the start. Why does he know Raidon? Why did he choose to ignore Nemona's question? Why did he get so mad at the mention of his parent? It's obvious that there's more to him, and that makes you curious.
I distinctly remember pretending to not remember him when I talked to him again at school. I wanted to be mean to to him since he was mean to us. And after the first titan, he gets out Mabosstiff off screen after our character left. At that point I wonder if he had any evil intentions, I didn't reallt trust him yet but I wanted to find out what's up with him.
All those suspicions vanished pretty quickly after the next few titans obviously, but the fact that I was hesitant to trust him made him so much more interesting to me because I actually spent some thought thinking about what his deal might be. If he was friendly right from the beginning and honest about his intentions he would've been far less memorable to me because he'd be so much more generic. This way it also gives him character growth, showing that he has to grow to trust us first and opens us to us eventually.

Honestly, when you consider the shit he went through, he could've been way more of an asshole than he was. Nigga has been completely by himself for several years despite being a teenager and basically raised himself. It's unrealistic how well adjusted he is considering how he's been heavily neglected since his childhood.

com:
"Eri is cute!" edition

Old bread: >>52579306

Welcome to the Raidcat / 6 Star Tera Raid Meta Thread
Use this thread to trade for raidcats, to organize (raidcat) raids, or just to discuss and ask questions about raids in general.

>lol I can solo 5 star raids I don't need your ugly cat
6 stars are infinitely harder than 5 and extremely annoying. You can do them the normal way and risk wasting your time, or accept the raidcat as your raid savior.

>What's the meta?
4 Perrserkers. Their Hidden Ability stacks multiplicatively and, if you follow the flowchart, you can one-shot most raids.

>What's the raidcat like?
Perrserker @ Lum Berry
Level 100
Ability: Steely Spirit (Hidden Ability)
EVs: 252 Atk / 252 Speed (Host) or HP (Joiner)
Adamant Nature
- Iron Head
- Screech
- Swords Dance
- Taunt (Host) / Helping Hand (Joiner)

>Host? Joiner? Flowchart?
There's a small difference in strategy whether you are hosting or joining a raid and a specific flowchart. See OP pic.

>Does this work every time?
No, but it's one of the only consistent strategies that you can follow. It's not great against Pokemon that have strong and/or STAB Fire/Fighting/Ground moves, and if their Tera resists Steel it can also take a few more turn (but still doable).

>So what's the hype?
Catraids are simple to organize, have plenty of flowcharts, and finish the job very quickly. It's about efficiency.

>I have a question about raids...
Check OP pic.

>How to get cat with HA?
Language Teacher sidequest, then use an Ability Patch to change its ability. Patch is an 11% drop from 6 Star Raids.

>I tried breeding but I'm getting Kantonian Meowth
Make the G-Meowth hold an Everstone

>wtf I did that but none of them have Steely Spirit
G-Meowth's HA is Unnerve, it becomes Steely Spirit upon evolution.

For other viable meta strategies and mons, Ctrl+F OTHERMONS
For specific strategies, Ctrl+F HARDRAIDS
